docs.lead_paragraph: Indonesia has stopped sending samples of the virus to the World Health Organization, apparently because it is negotiating a contract with an American vaccine company.

headline.main: Indonesia May Sell, Not Give, Bird Flu Virus to Scientists
headline.print_headline: Indonesia May Sell, Not Give, Bird Flu Virus to Scientists

docs.snippet: Indonesia has stopped sending samples of the virus to the World Health Organization, apparently because it is negotiating a contract with an American vaccine company.

docs.lead_paragraph: Indonesia, which has had more human cases of avian flu than any other country, has stopped sending samples of the virus to the World Health Organization, apparently because it is negotiating a contract to sell the samples to an American vaccine company, a W.H.O. official said yesterday. The strains of the H5N1 virus circulating in Indonesia are considered crucial to developing up-to-date vaccines and following mutations in the virus. The official, Dr. David L. Heymann, said the agency was ''clearly concerned'' about the development and was in talks with Indonesia.

headline.main: Indonesia May Sell, Not Give, Bird Flu Virus to Scientists

docs.abstract: Indonesia, which has more human cases of bird flu than any other country, stops sending virus samples to WHO, apparently because of negotiations to sell samples to American vaccine maker; strains of H5N1 virus circulating in Indonesia are considered crucial to developing up-to-date vaccines and following mutations; Dr David L Heymann of WHO expresses concern; Baxter Healthcare signs memo of agreement but says company has not asked Indonesia to stop cooperating with WHO and would not get exclusive access to Indonesian strains; action also upsets procedures for developing seasonal flu vaccines and could set dangerous example for other countries (M)
docs.snippet: Indonesia, which has had more human cases of avian flu than any other country, has stopped sending samples of the virus to the World Health Organization, apparently because it is negotiating a contract to sell the samples to an American vaccine...

headline.main: A Vaccine to Save Women’s Lives
headline.print_headline: A Vaccine to Save Women’s Lives

docs.lead_paragraph: Rainbow had the bad luck to try to have a baby on a Thursday. Thursday was her doctor's day off, and there was no one else for miles who could handle a complicated breech birth, not when the mother was a Holstein cow.

headline.main: Drop in Veterinarians Spells Trouble on Farms

docs.abstract: Veterinarians who care for large animals that provide US with food are in short supply; veterinarians can earn more money tending cats and dogs; fewer students come from farm backgrounds and are not interested rural jobs; more women are becoming veterinarians and are less inclined than men to take on dangers of dealing with large animals; problem is greatest in rural areas, and Congress has enacted law to repay student loans of veterinarians working in underserved areas; states are also jumping in with loan repayment or grant programs; dearth of food-animal veterinarians reflects seismic shifts in farming, veterinary medicine, economy and American culture; photo (M)
docs.snippet: Rainbow had the bad luck to try to have a baby on a Thursday.     Thursday was her doctor's day off, and there was no one else for miles who could handle a complicated breech birth, not when the mother was a Holstein cow.
